We are a group of people who believe awareness has the potential to prevent accidents.
Project 24 is dedicated to the 24 young engineers who lost their lives in Beas River on June 8th, 2014.
Project 24 is an effort to identify the accident prone zones across the globe by means of community and governmental support.
Can I add a risk prone location?

Yes. You have to login using your Facebook account or Gmail account. Then press the navigation bar and click on ‘Add your area’. You have to click a picture of the area and send it to us. This picture will be verified by our team and it will be added by us.
Why do I have to login to report a location on Project 24?
Social sign-in feature will keep the reporting procedure much more authentic. A user can still use all the essential features of Project 24 without logging in.
Project 24 is an accident prone area alert application which will locate the potentially risky zones and make the data available to the user.
Are all the reported ocations accurate on Project 24?
No. The location data is represented based on our best estimate.
Can I use Project 24 without access to internet?
Project 24 supports offline maps. A user will be able to use Project24 without internet connection if he has google offline maps available on his device for a particular location.
Why Project 24? Are all accident prone areas updated on Project 24?

Project 24 was created with a strong belief that awareness has a potential to avoid accidents. This app is dedicated to the 24 young engineers who lost their lives in Beas river on June 8th,2014. We are working hard to update the accident prone areas.
